Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the images are all broke/etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> They have an app

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> But I think it's just a "VPN"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> basically sucking up your daata

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Who knows what the code of that app is doing, and where it is sending the data

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but you can promise, nobody builds apps for free. Somebody is sucking up your data to be sold to somebody else

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> I like to know these things to tell other users

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Otherwise, how does that company pay the devs that write the apps?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Exactly

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Sell data

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> With Hush, you know where the funds come from. The 10% FR funds development, we will never sell data to anybody about Hush users. I would rather delete the Hush git repo and stop working on it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> It's cool to say, we are Hush and we do this.
It's better to say, we are Hush and we do this, and these guys do this. And this is why we want you to use Hush

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Loki, that is a real project, but I don't know how their messenger works. I think it requires their masternodes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush has always been against masternodes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> And if other projects do good things, good.
But we know what we do

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Loki is built on Monero codebase, and that has no memo field. There is no way to do chat-based stuff directly on the blockchain, with standard XMR tools. Maybe they added stuff, but it makes me feel like the chat messages are just routed by masternodes, but not actually on the blockchain. I have no idea

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> People know Duke Leto and know that he is trustworthy, and they know what he has done. 
You have a proven record of working with privacy.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I read the Loki whitepaper over a year ago and I don't think it said much about chat then

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> You think it's nothing to do with monero

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> It is something separate, an add on

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> So, masternodes get paid to route your chat messages, that is what I think Loki is doing

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Monero has no memo field, and so it has no way to send encrypted data to your recipient

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Only Zcash protocol does that. Now, I am not a Monero expert, and maybe things have been extended or changed. But that is how I understand it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> I'll go ask. And download the white paper

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> There will be different implementations of chat than Hush will implement. All Hush operations are "on-chain"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> File uploads, every chat message, every single one is stored on-chain forever

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> What is the advantage/disadvantage to that?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> in encrypted form

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> scalability is the concern

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> I see

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but, also, it opens up use cases

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> many use cases of HushList, absolutely need on-chain stuff. Otherwise, you can't prove that you knew something at a certain time, and you wouldn't get all the censorship-resistance

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Every Hush full node is a backup of all data stored on Hush blockchain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Really?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> All of it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> memo fields are encrypted

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> only owners of the private key of the receiving address can decrypt it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but it's all there, encrypted, on every single Hush full node

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> So, protip: For sensitive data, encrypted data AGAIN, inside the memo field, is a good idea. Just plan for the worst

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> I guess it's necessary to have all of the data

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> nodes can choose to delete some data, but all full nodes have access to the data. Some full nodes can "prune" their data to use less disk space

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> I'm going to start download tonight

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> current Hush blockchain is about 600MB on disk

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and you need to download 50MB of sapling files

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Np

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> That's not too bad

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Verus Agama took forever to dl

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if you are using hush binaries, they still might download more stuff. It's only the newest code that got rid of that and we haven't released binaries yet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Had to download Zcashparams

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> yes, it will do all that stuff

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> in the future binaries, those downloads won't be necessary

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> It's just a DL

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Thats a small thing lol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> I can't find it in me, to ever bitch about a DL or setup lol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> People work too hard for that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Well, I appreciate that. Many of us have access to good internet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Mostly I work on that stuff for all the people without good internet, and also for Tor users, where bandwidth is at a premium

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and the #1 reason, was because it bothered me. None of those downloads were *actually* needed, but because of lots of technical debt, were required for no good reason. That just really bothered me

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I had to modify freaking Rust code to prevent those files from being downloaded, and at first I gave up but then went back to it and figured it out

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> 
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/407861562108542988/609598334277255169/Screenshot_20190809-230557_Haven.jpg

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Yeah we are lucky to have very good access to good internet, at good prices.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> And a lot of people still use dial-up

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> I used dial up 20+ yrs ago

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> 1/5th of a century ago

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> That's perspective

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> Internet isn't everything.
But it is something to be thankful, that we have this technology and it's easy to access and not expensive

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Privatoshi> With that appreciation, then we can begin to understand the need for privacy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and yes, I also fondly remember the sounds of dial-up modems and even writing my own connection scripts for linux manually. Fun times
